All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AbstractDAO<T>
The AbstractDAO class provides common methods for data access objects (DAOs).
Bill
The Bill class represents a bill record.
BillBLL
Constructs a new instance of the BillBLL class.
BillDAO
The BillDAO class provides methods to interact with the "bill" table in the database.
Client
The Client class represents a client.
ClientBLL
 
ClientDAO
The ClientDAO class provides data access methods for the Client model.
ClientValidator
The ClientValidator class is responsible for validating Client objects.
ConnectionFactory
 
Controller
The Controller class handles the interaction between the View and the Business Logic Layer (BLL).
Main
The main class of the application.
Order
The Order class represents an order.
OrderBLL
 
OrderDAO
The OrderDAO class provides data access methods for the Order model.
OrderValidator
The OrderValidator class is responsible for validating Order objects.
Product
The Product class represents a product.
ProductBLL
 
ProductDAO
TheProductDAO class provides data access methods for the Product model.
ProductValidator
The ProductValidator class is responsible for validating Product objects.
TableView
A class responsible for creating a window that contains a table.
Validator<T>
The Validator interface defines a contract for validating objects of type T.
ViewClient
A class representing the client view.
ViewOrder
A class representing the order view.
ViewProduct
A class representing the product view.
ViewStart
A class representing the start view.
